http://www.abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory?id=1911033
 
 
WASHINGTON May 1, 2006 (AP)- Three years after delivering his "mission accomplished" speech on Iraq, President Bush on Monday declared another turning point had arrived with the establishment of a permanent government in Baghdad. 
 
 "We believe we've got partners to help the Iraqi people realize their dreams," Bush said of the recent emergence of new Iraqi leadership. "They need to know that we stand with them." 

 
 
 If history holds, the fact that Bush has announced a trunign point means that things will get worse.
 
 You have to wonder exactly how delusional the folks in Washington are. If it takes 4 months to form the government, after all the infrastructure to do so is in place, what do you think it is going to be like when they actually get to the point that they start trying to pass legislation?

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Turning point in Iraq
